intro: Cryptantha hansenii, commonly known as Hansen's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as sagebrush steppe and grasslands. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Cryptantha hansenii is often found in open areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
